results.title: Road without wheels
results.creator_credit: Quantum Films, Anthony Buckley and Robert Raymond
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man on the rim series”.
Part 3 in the series. “The Powerhouse” explores the powerhouse aspect of China’s long history which displays her inventiveness beginning with the Han dynasty. “Pure and simple” shows how the Japanese, despite their close affinity with China, have fought with the utmost determination to remain distinctive. “Road without wheels” In South America, isolated from the rest of the world, the Indians produced their own remarkable range of food, invented the wheel but never used it for transport, and developed their own unique culture.

results.title: Road transport trends
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board and Jim Stirling
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the growing importance and use of Victoria’s roads by transports and by private motorists. Shows the assistance given to designers of motor vehicles in estimating probable load capacity by the Country Roads Board. Explains the careful control of over-dimensional loads for which 15,000 permits are needed annually and show the detailed planning needed for safe and convenient handling of such loads as mobile cranes, houses and earth-moving equipment for which escorts, special equipment and timing is needed.

results.title: Road to Zanzibar
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Paul Jones and Victor Schertzinger
results.brief_description: The second of the “Road” series sees Chuck (Crosby) and his pal Fearless (Hope) fleeing a South African carnival after their sideshow causes a fire. After several similar escapades, they finally save enough money to return to the States, where Chuck spends it all on a ‘lost’ diamond mine. But that’s only the beginning. Before long, a pair of attractive con-women have tricked our heroes into financing a comic safari, featuring numerous burlesque jungle adventures. Much of the film’s humour reportedly derived from on-set improvisations. Cast includes Bing Crosby, Bob Hope, Dorothy Lamour and Una Merkel. Costume design, Edith Head.

results.title: Road to yesterday. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This is a shortened version with music and commentary of Cecil B. De Mille’s elaborate 1925 romantic drama on the theme of reincarnation. An estranged couple are involved in a disastrous train crash and revert to their former lives in the Middle Ages. The train wreck was a remarkable piece of staging, placing the lives of the leading actors at risk.

results.title: Road to the West
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: The story of the early days of Sydney Cove told by means of historical stills and by the re-enactment of the crossing of the Blue Mountains by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson, the resulting development and relics of that period, including the old Court House at Hartley. Today fast transport enables commuters to travel to and from Sydney and the Blue Mountains in less than two hours, passing through towns named after the three explorers.

results.title: Road to the stamping ground (A)
results.creator_credit: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, RM Arts and David Muir
results.brief_description: A choreographical journey with Jiri Kylian of the Netherland’s Dance Theatre into the world of dance in Indigenous Australia. The documentary which opens the program follows Kylian’s visit to the Groot Eylandt tribal dance congregation in 1986 where his dance production Stamping Ground was first conceived. In Stamping Ground Kylian sought to underline the common qualities of ballet and Aboriginal tribal dance as well as fuse the two styles into a work that comments on the universal nature of human movement as a form of cultural and personal expression. Following interviews with the Dance company performers about the piece and footage of rehearsals demonstrating movements inspired by Kylian’s time at the Groot Eylandt congregation, the second half of the program is a presentation of the final performance of Stamping Ground by the Netherlands Dance Theatre Company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, RM Arts and David Muir

results.title: Road to Singapore
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Harlan Thompson and Victor Schertzinger
results.brief_description: Comedy venture from the team of Bob Hope and Bing Crosby, “The Road to Singapore” is a sprightly film that consistently amuses and entertains. Crosby plays Josh Mallon, the irresponsible son of a shipping magnate who would rather hang with his carefree sailor buddy Ace Lannigan (Hope) than realise his father’s lofty aspirations for him. On the eve of his wedding to long-time fiancee Gloria, Josh hightails it to Singapore with Ace in tow. Once there, the boys’ friendship falls under a cloud when they’re both attracted to saucy nightclub singer Mima (Dorothy Lamour) who goes on the lam from her possessive boyfriend Caesar (Anthony Quinn). As the boys slug it out for Mima’s affections, Gloria turns up in search of her wayward husband to be. The exoticism, spontaneity, lushness and passion of the East is contrasted with the cool, emotionless Western moneyed arena of Gloria’s world. Watch for an intriguing scene in which Crosby and Hope go ‘native’. This successful film, featuring several musical interludes, spawned six more “Road to…” movies starring Hope and Crosby.

results.title: Road to security
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.
results.description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.

results.title: Road to Nhill
results.creator_credit: Gecko Films, Australian Film Commission, Sue Maslin and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: This affectionate observation of life in a small country town follows the events of a lazy summer’s afternoon in Pyramid Hill, Victoria. A car load of local lady bowlers flips over on the way home from a tournament. Confusion escalates as word about the accident spreads around the town. Husbands go astray searching for their wives; helpful passers-by take the women involved in the accident in all directions; the ambulance gets lost; and the local policeman misses the accident all together. The film is the first feature for the director/ producer/writer team after several years of documentaries and short films, many of them award-winning.

results.title: Road to independence
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ronald Dick and Nicholas Balla
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
There is world-wide significance in the planned process by which Britain is helping her colonies master the art of self-government. This concluding film cites recent developments in Ghana, Nigeria, Nyasaland and other colonial territories where political evolution has seen striking progress in recent years. Edgar McInnis analyzes these developments on the basis of two main considerations; and why a ruling power should arrange for its own departure from its colonies; why, once independent, the former subjects should continue to associate with their former master.
